title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 7): Foraging Guilds as Resistance - Building Power With Through Wild Food & Medicine
summary: Learn to forage and wildcraft together ethically and collectively as a form of rewilding autonomy. Build living networks that restore reciprocal relationships with local ecosystems while strengthening community trust.

Food.summary: Decentralize food and medicine knowledge through ethical collective foraging and wildcrafting.

level0: Start with curiosity and consent - invite co-learners, not experts
Map your bioregion together using community knowledge and resources
level1: Develop shared ethics around abundant harvesting and reciprocal stewardship
Host seasonal learning walks in safe, accessible areas
level2: Share skills horizontally - honor everyone's knowledge and experience
Practice tending more than taking - seed collection, invasive removal
level3: Stay decentralized - create open resources others can copy and remix
Build bioregional networks of foraging guilds

Knowledge.summary: Build embodied knowledge of local ecosystems while practicing collective learning.

level0: Learn plant identification and seasonal rhythms together
Study Indigenous knowledge when shared with proper consent
level1: Document learnings in shared notebooks or digital folders
Practice identifying toxic vs edible plants safely
level2: Develop expertise in local medicinal and food plants
Teach plant ID and ethics to new members
level3: Become bioregional resource for ethical foraging practices
Create educational materials and guides for community use

Community.summary: Build trust and reciprocal relationships through shared land-based learning.

level0: Use consensus decision-making for all guild activities
level1: Build trust through shared embodied experiences in nature
Host story-sharing circles for intergenerational knowledge
level2: Create medicine-making sessions and communal meals with harvests
Support members in developing land-based relationships
level3: Build permanent community infrastructure around land stewardship
Model reciprocal relationship with more-than-human world

Narrative.summary: Transform relationship with land from extraction to reciprocity and care.

level0: Practice seeing land as teacher rather than resource
Learn ethics of reciprocal stewardship vs extraction
level1: Share stories about connection to local ecosystems
Challenge narratives of human separation from nature
level2: Help others understand foraging as relationship-building
Model consent-based approaches to land interaction
level3: Transform community culture toward ecological reciprocity
Build widespread understanding of humans as part of ecosystem
